text:
Wheaton is a city in Pottawatomie County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 95 people lived there.
History.
The first post office in Wheaton was founded in 1870. It was called Leghorn until 1883. The post office remained in operation until it was closed in 1992.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Demographics.
Wheaton is part of the Manhattan, Kansas Metropolitan Statistical Area.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 95 people, 34 households, and 24 families living in the city.
